column4: I have a weird problem with sensors: it only shows temp of core0 and core2 but I think it detected all 4 cores when I installed sensors for the first time. is there a solution for this?
could be that those two monitors are malfunctioning and not reporting.
if it's showing two of them but not the other two then I'd go for the two not showing being broken. There shouldn't be different modules for each monitor
when you say "broken".. you mean the hardware or configuration?
could be configuration selected to not report those two actually, you could take a look at that. I'd go for hardware though
like I said before.. I remember it detected all cores
hardware failure then. You could try from a live session to see if it picks them up, or another operating system
on the moon is my guess
do you have another operating system at hand you could check on to see if the monitors are functioning?
you could try on backtrack. I'd go for Windows anyway since that's a whole different kernel and suchlike
if u know a free app for win7 pm me
speccy or CPU-Z should be able to tell you core temperatures

then that's probably onboard. GPUs that don't have dedicated video memory (i.e. onboard GPUs) borrow from the system memory. 256MB would seem pretty normal and would give you 3.7GB instead of the full 4GB
